verses.verse: After [a few] days he again entered Capernaum, and the news spread that he was in the house.
Immediately many gathered together, so much so that there was no room to hold them, no, not so much as around the door, and he preached the word to them.
And they came to him bringing one who was paralyzed, carried by four men.
When they could not come near him because of the crowd, they uncovered the roof where he was. When they had broken through it, they let down the bed on which he laid.
When Jesus saw their faith, he said to the paralyzed man, "Son, your sins are forgiven."
But certain Scribes were sitting there and thinking in their hearts,
"Why does this man speak this blasphemy? Who can forgive sins except God alone?"
Immediately when Jesus perceived in his spirit that they were thinking this in themselves, he said to them, "Why are you thinking these things in your hearts?
"Which is easier to say to the paralyzed, «Your sins are forgiven' or to say, «Get up and pick up your bed and walk?'
"So that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins -he says to the paralyzed-
I say to you, «Stand up, pick up your bed, and go to your house."
Immediately he got up, picked up his bed, and left in front of them all, so that all were in shock and glorified God saying, "We never saw anything like this."
Again he went to the seashore. The entire multitude went with him, and he taught them.
As he passed by, he saw Levi, the son of Alphaeus, sitting at the tax collector's office and said to him, "Follow me." He got up and followed him.
And it came about that (as Jesus and his disciples sat to eat in [Levi's] house) many tax collectors and sinners sat together with Jesus and his disciples (for there were many who followed him).
When the Scribes and Pharisees saw him eat with tax collectors and sinners, they said to his disciples, "How is it that he eats and drinks with tax collectors and sinners?"
When Jesus heard, he said to them, "Those who are well have no need of a physician, but those who are sick do. I did not come to call the righteous but sinners to repentance."
The disciples of John and of the Pharisees routinely fasted, and they came and said to him, "Why do the disciples of John and the Pharisees fast, but your disciples don't?"
Jesus said to them, "Can the bridegroom's friends fast while the bridegroom is with them? As long as they have the bridegroom with them, they cannot fast.
"But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, then they will fast in those days.
"Also no one sews a piece of new cloth on an old garment, else the new piece, that filled the hole, tears away from the old, and the tear is made worse.
"And no one puts new wine into old skins, else the new wine will burst the skins, and the wine spills and the skins destroyed. New wine must be put into new skins."
Next he went through the grain fields on the Sabbath, and his disciples started, as they were going through, to pull off the heads of grain.
The Pharisees said to him, "Look! Why are they--on the Sabbath doing--that which is unlawful?"
And he said to them, "Have you never read what David did when he was in need and was hungry, he and those who were with him?
"How he went into the house of God in the days of Abiathar the High Priest and ate the showbread, which is not lawful to eat except for the priests, and gave to those who were with him also."
And he said to them, "The Sabbath was made for man and not man for the Sabbath.
"Therefore the Son of Man is Lord even of the Sabbath."
